title: Citi Named by Global Finance Magazine "Best Corporate/Institutional Internet Bank" in Latin America for Sixth Consecutive Year
summary: Miami, Florida - For the sixth consecutive year, Citi has been named by Global Finance magazine as the Best Corporate/Institutional Internet Bank in Latin America in the magazine's World's Best Internet Banks 2012 Awards. Citi was also recognized as Best Global Overall Internet Bank and Best Corporate/Institutional Internet Bank at the global level.
tag-1: Citi Named by Global Finance Magazine "Best Corporate/Institutional Internet Bank" in Latin America for Sixth Consecutive Year
tag-2: Miami, Florida – For the sixth consecutive year, Citi has been named by Global Finance magazine as the Best Corporate/Institutional Internet Bank in Latin America in the magazine's World's Best Internet Banks 2012 Awards. Citi was also recognized as Best Global Overall Internet Bank and Best Corporate/Institutional Internet Bank at the global level.
tag-3: Global Finance's World Best Internet Bank Awards are based on submissions from banks that wish to be considered. This year, 220 individual banks from around the world entered the competition. Representatives from Infosys comprised the judging panel. Based on the judges' evaluations, Global Finance's editors made the final selections.
tag-4: Winners were selected based on strength of strategy for attracting and servicing online customers, success in getting clients to use web offerings, growth of online customer base, breadth of products offered, evidence of tangible benefits gained from internet initiatives, and web site design and functionality. Sub-category winners were selected on the basis of relative strength of those products and services.
tag-5: "These awards are testament to our innovative internet banking platform offered to clients around the world and in Latin America," said Fernando Iraola, Latin America and Mexico region head, Citi Transaction Services. "We are committed to continue providing the best-in-class solutions to our institutional and corporate clients in the region to fulfill their internet banking needs."

tag-10: Global Finance Global Finance is a monthly magazine founded in 1987 by publishing entrepreneurs Joseph Giarraputo and Carl Burgen. Giarraputo continues as Publisher and Editorial Director. Its mission is to help corporate leaders, bankers and investors chart the course of global business and finance. The magazine has a circulation of 50,050, audited by BPA, and readers in 163 countries. Its headquarters is in New York, with offices in London, Rio de Janeiro and Milan. Global Finance's audience includes Chairmen, Presidents, CEOs, CFOs, Treasurers and other senior financial officers responsible for making investment and strategic business decisions at multinational companies and financial institutions.
